intro: Pandanus tenuipedunculatus, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed pandanus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and long, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear fragrant, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional crafts and as thatching material. The species is adapted to coastal and wetland environments, thriving in humid, tropical climates.
